member.name: P:FParsec.State`1.LineBegin
member.summary: The stream index of the first char in the line, i.e. Index - Column + 1.

member.name: P:FParsec.State`1.Column
member.summary: The 1-based index of the UTF16 char in the line, i.e. Index - LineBegin + 1.

member.name: T:FParsec.StringBuffer
member.summary: A substring of a pinned string on the large object heap. StringBuffers are cached in a pool and hence need to be properly disposed.

member.name: F:FParsec.StringBuffer.Allocated
member.summary: Sum of the lengths of all currently allocated StringBuffers

member.name: F:FParsec.StringBuffer.PoolSegment.Last
member.summary: the last allocated segment

member.name: P:FParsec.StringBuffer.PoolSegment.Size
member.summary: String.Length - x, where x > 0

member.name: T:FParsec.CharStream
member.summary: Provides access to the char content of a binary Stream (or a String) through an iterator-based interface that is especially well suited for parser applications.

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.BufferString
member.summary: The string holding the char buffer, or null if the buffer is not part of a .NET string.

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.BufferStringPointer
member.summary: A pointer to the beginning of BufferString, or null if BufferString is null.

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.BufferHandle
member.summary: Holds the GCHandle for CharStreams directly constructed from strings or char arrays.

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.Buffer
member.summary: Holds the StringBuffer for CharStreams constructed from a binary stream.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.ReadAllRemainingCharsFromStream(System.Char*,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IO.Stream,System.Int64,System.Text.Decoder)
member.summary: Reads all remaining chars into the given buffer. If the remaining stream content holds more than the given maximum number of chars, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a CharStream from the chars in the string argument between the indices index (inclusive) and index + length (exclusive).
member.exception: chars is null.
At least one of the following conditions is not satisfied: index ≥ 0, length ≥ 0 and index + length ≤ chars.Length.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs a CharStream from the chars in the string argument between the indices index (inclusive) and index + length (exclusive). The first char in the stream is assigned the index streamBeginIndex.
member.exception: chars is null.
At least one of the following conditions is not satisfied: index ≥ 0, length ≥ 0, index + length ≤ chars.Length and 0 ≤ streamBeginIndex < 2^60.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.#ctor(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a CharStream from the chars in the char array argument between the indices index (inclusive) and index + length (exclusive).
member.exception: chars is null.
At least one of the following conditions is not satisfied: index ≥ 0, length ≥ 0 and index + length ≤ chars.Length.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.#ctor(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs a CharStream from the chars in the char array argument between the indices index (inclusive) and index + length (exclusive). The first char in the stream is assigned the index streamBeginIndex.
member.exception: chars is null.
At least one of the following conditions is not satisfied: index ≥ 0, length ≥ 0, index + length ≤ chars.Length and 0 ≤ streamBeginIndex < 2^60.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.#ctor(System.Char*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a CharStream from the length chars at the pointer address.
member.exception: chars is null.
length is negative.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.#ctor(System.Char*,System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs a CharStream from the length chars at the pointer address. The first char in the stream is assigned the index streamBeginIndex.
member.exception: chars is null.
At least one of the following conditions is not satisfied: length ≥ 0 and 0 ≤ streamBeginIndex < 2^60.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.#ctor(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary:
Constructs a CharStream from the file at the given path.
Is equivalent to CharStream(new FileStream(path, FileMode.Open, FileAccess.Read, FileShare.Read, 4096, FileOptions.SequentialScan), false, encoding, true, defaultBlockSize, defaultBlockSize/3, ((defaultBlockSize/3)*2)/3, defaultByteBufferLength).

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.#ctor(System.String,System.Text.Encoding,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Constructs a CharStream from the file at the given path.
Is equivalent to CharStream(new FileStream(path, FileMode.Open, FileAccess.Read, FileShare.Read, 4096, FileOptions.SequentialScan), false, encoding, detectEncodingFromByteOrderMarks, defaultBlockSize, defaultBlockSize/3, ((defaultBlockSize/3)*2)/3, defaultByteBufferLength).

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.#ctor(System.String,System.Text.Encoding,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Constructs a CharStream from the file at the given path.
Is equivalent to CharStream(new FileStream(path, FileMode.Open, FileAccess.Read, FileShare.Read, 4096, FileOptions.SequentialScan), false, encoding, detectEncodingFromByteOrderMarks, blockSize, blockOverlap, minRegexSpace, byteBufferLength).

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary:
Constructs a CharStream from a byte Stream.
Is equivalent to CharStream(stream, false, encoding, true, defaultBlockSize, defaultBlockSize/3, ((defaultBlockSize/3)*2)/3, defaultByteBufferLength).

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary:
Constructs a CharStream from a byte Stream.
Is equivalent to CharStream(stream, leaveOpen, encoding, true, defaultBlockSize, defaultBlockSize/3, ((defaultBlockSize/3)*2)/3, defaultByteBufferLength).

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean,System.Text.Encoding,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Constructs a CharStream from a byte Stream.
Is equivalent to CharStream(stream, leaveOpen, encoding, detectEncodingFromByteOrderMarks, defaultBlockSize, defaultBlockSize/3, ((defaultBlockSize/3)*2)/3, defaultByteBufferLength).

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean,System.Text.Encoding,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a CharStream from a byte Stream.
member.param: The byte stream providing the input.
Indicates whether the byte Stream should be left open when the CharStream has finished reading it.
The (default) Encoding used for decoding the byte Stream into chars.
Indicates whether the constructor should detect the encoding from a unicode byte-order mark at the beginning of the stream. An encoding detected from a byte-order mark overrides the default encoding.
The number of chars per block. The default is 3×2^16 ≈ 200k.

The number of chars at the end of a block that are preserved when reading the next block into the char buffer. It must be less than blockSize/2, but not less than encoding.GetMaxCharCount(1). The default is blockSize/3.

The number of chars that are guaranteed to be visible to a regular expression when it is matched on the stream (assuming there are enough chars remaining in the stream). Must not be greater than blockOverlap. The default is 2/3 of blockOverlap.
The size of the byte buffer used for decoding purposes. The default is 2^12 = 4KB.

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.DoNotRoundUpBlockSizeToSimplifyTesting
member.summary: we modify this flag via reflection in the unit test

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.PositiveDistance(System.Char*,System.Char*)
member.summary: an optimized version of end - begin, which assumes that 2^31 > end - begin >= 0.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.Seek(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns an iterator pointing to the given index in the stream, or to the end of the stream if the indexed position lies beyond the last char in the stream.
member.exception: The index is negative or less than the BeginIndex.
Accessing the char with the given index requires seeking in the underlying byte stream, but the byte stream does not support seeking or the Encoding's Decoder is not serializable.
An I/O error occured.
The input stream contains invalid bytes and the encoding was constructed with the throwOnInvalidBytes option.
The input stream contains invalid bytes for which the decoder fallback threw this exception.
Can not allocate enough memory for the internal data structure.
Method is called after the stream was disposed.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.FoldCase(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a case-folded copy of the string argument. All chars are mapped using the (non-Turkic) 1-to-1 case folding mappings (v. 5.1) for Unicode code points in the Basic Multilingual Plane, i.e. code points below 0x10000. If the argument is null, null is returned.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.NormalizeNewlines(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the given string with all occurrences of "\r\n" and "\r" replaced by "\n". If the argument is null, null is returned.

member.name: P:FParsec.CharStream.Encoding
member.summary: The Encoding that is used for decoding the underlying byte stream, or System.Text.UnicodeEncoding in case the stream was directly constructed from a string.

member.name: P:FParsec.CharStream.Block
member.summary: The current block in BufferString.

member.name: P:FParsec.CharStream.BufferCount
member.summary: The number of chars in BufferString.

member.name: P:FParsec.CharStream.BeginIndex
member.summary: The index of the first char in the stream, i.e. Begin.Index. This value is determined by the streamBeginIndex argument of some of the CharStream constructors. By default this value is 0.

member.name: P:FParsec.CharStream.EndIndex
member.summary: The index of the last char of the stream plus 1, or Int64.MaxValue if the end of stream has not yet been detected.

member.name: P:FParsec.CharStream.Begin
member.summary: An iterator pointing to the beginning of the stream (or to the end if the CharStream is empty).

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.BlockInfo.ByteIndex
member.summary: the byte stream index of the first char in the block after the OverhangCharsAtBlockBegin

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.BlockInfo.ByteBufferIndex
member.summary: the value of the CharStream's ByteBufferIndex before the block is read

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.BlockInfo.NumberOfBytesInOverlap
member.summary: the number of bytes in the stream from ByteIndex to the first char after the OverhangCharsAfterOverlap

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.BlockInfo.LastCharInOverlap
member.summary: the last char in the overlap with the previous block (used for integrity checking)

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.BlockInfo.OverhangCharsAtBlockBegin
member.summary: chars at the block begin that were already read together with chars of the last block before the overlap

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.BlockInfo.OverhangCharsAfterOverlap
member.summary: chars after the overlap with the previous block that were already read together with the overlap chars

member.name: T:FParsec.CharStream.Anchor
member.summary: Represents the link between a CharStream and its Iterators. May be allocated on the unmanaged heap and holds a GCHandle, hence must be properly freed.

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.Anchor.LastBlock
member.summary: The index of the last block of the stream, or Int32.MaxValue if the end of stream has not yet been detected.

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.Anchor.BufferBegin
member.summary: Begin of the used part of the char buffer (stays constant). Is null if the CharStream is empty.

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.Anchor.BufferEnd
member.summary: End of the used part of the char buffer (varies for a multi-block stream). Is null if the CharStream is empty.

member.name: T:FParsec.CharStream.MultiBlockData
member.summary: Contains the data and methods needed in case the input byte stream is large enough to span multiple blocks of the CharStream.

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.MultiBlockData.RegexSpaceThreshold
member.summary: BufferBegin + BlockSize - minRegexSpace

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.MultiBlockData.FillByteBuffer
member.summary: Refills the ByteBuffer if no unused byte is remaining. Returns the number of unused bytes in the (refilled) ByteBuffer.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.MultiBlockData.ClearAndRefillByteBuffer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Refills the ByteBuffer starting at the given index. If the underlying byte stream contains enough bytes, the ByteBuffer is filled up to the ByteBuffer.Length. Returns the number of bytes available for consumption in the refilled ByteBuffer.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.MultiBlockData.ReadCharsFromStream(System.Char*,System.Int32,System.String@)
member.summary: Reads up to the given maximum number of chars into the given buffer. If more than the maximum number of chars have to be read from the stream in order to fill the buffer (due to the way the Decoder API works), the overhang chars are returned through the output parameter. Returns a pointer to one char after the last char read.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.MultiBlockData.ReadBlock(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a block of chars (must be different from the current block) into the BufferString. Returns a pointer to the first char of the new block, or null if no chars could be read.

member.name: P:FParsec.CharStream.MultiBlockData.ByteIndex
member.summary: The byte stream index of the first unused byte in the ByteBuffer.

member.name: T:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator
member.summary: The iterator type for CharStreams.

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.EndOfStreamChar
member.summary: The char returned by Read() if the iterator has reached the end of the stream. The value is '\uFFFF'.

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.Ptr
member.summary: Pointer to the current char in the CharStream's buffer (if the CharStream's current block equals Block).

member.name: F:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.Block
member.summary: The buffer block for which Ptr is valid.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.Advance(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an Iterator that is advanced by offset chars. The Iterator can't move past the end of the stream, i.e. any position beyond the last char in the stream is interpreted as precisely one char beyond the last char.
member.exception: The new position would lie before the beginning of the `CharStream`.
Seeking of the underlying byte stream is required, but the byte stream does not support seeking or the Encodings's Decoder is not serializable.
An I/O error occured.
The input stream contains invalid bytes and the encoding was constructed with the throwOnInvalidBytes option.
The input stream contains invalid bytes for which the decoder fallback threw this exception.

member.summary: Returns true if and only if the char argument matches the char pointed to by the Iterator. At the end of the stream Match always returns false.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.Match(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if chars matches the chars in the stream beginning with the char pointed to by the Iterator. If the chars do not match or if there are not enough chars remaining in the stream, false is returned. If chars is empty, true is returned.
member.exception: chars is null.
Seeking of the underlying byte stream is required, but the byte stream does not support seeking or the Encodings's Decoder is not serializable.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.MatchCaseFolded(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if caseFoldedChars matches the chars in the stream beginning with the char pointed to by the Iterator. The chars in the stream are case-folded before they are matched, while the chars in the string argument are assumed to already be case-folded. If the chars do not match or if there are not enough chars remaining in the stream, false is returned. If caseFoldedChars is empty, true is returned.
member.exception: caseFoldedChars is null.
Seeking of the underlying byte stream is required, but the byte stream does not support seeking or the Encodings's Decoder is not serializable.
An I/O error occured.
The input stream contains invalid bytes and the encoding was constructed with the throwOnInvalidBytes option.

member.summary: Returns true if the chars in chars between the indices charsIndex (inclusive) and charsIndex + length (exclusive) match the chars in the stream beginning with the char pointed to by the Iterator. If the chars do not match or if there are not enough chars remaining in the stream, false is returned. If length is 0, true is returned.
member.exception: charsIndex is negative, length is negative or charsIndex + length > chars.Length.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.MatchCaseFolded(System.Char*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the length chars at the pointer address match the chars in the stream beginning with the char pointed to by the Iterator. The chars in the stream are case-folded before they are matched, while the chars at the pointer address are assumed to already be case-folded. If the chars do not match or if there are not enough chars remaining in the stream, false is returned. If length is 0, true is returned.
member.exception: length is negative.
Seeking of the underlying byte stream is required, but the byte stream does not support seeking or the Encodings's Decoder is not serializable.
An I/O error occured.
The input stream contains invalid bytes and the encoding was constructed with the throwOnInvalidBytes option.
The input stream contains invalid bytes for which the decoder fallback threw this exception.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.Match(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex)
member.summary: Applies the given regular expression to stream chars beginning with the char pointed to by the Iterator. Returns the resulting Match object. (Not supported by CharStreams constructed from char arrays or pointers.)

remarks.para: For performance reasons you should specify the regular expression such that it can only match at the beginning of a string, for example by prepending "\A".

For CharStreams constructed from large binary streams the regular expression is not applied to a string containing all the remaining chars in the stream. The minRegexSpace parameter of the CharStream constructors determines the minimum number of chars that are guaranteed to be visible to the regular expression.

IMPORTANT:
If the CharStream has been constructed from a System.IO.Stream or a file path, the regular expression is applied to an internal mutable buffer. Since the Match object may work lazily, i.e. compute matched strings not before they are needed, you need to retrieve all the required information from the Match object before you continue to access the CharStream, otherwise you might get invalid results.

member.exception: regex is null.

Two possible reasons: 1) The CharStream was constructed from a char array or char pointer, in which case it does not support regular expression matching. 2) Seeking of the underlying byte stream is required, but the byte stream does not support seeking or the Encodings's Decoder is not serializable.
An I/O error occured.
The input stream contains invalid bytes and the encoding was constructed with the throwOnInvalidBytes option.
The input stream contains invalid bytes for which the decoder fallback threw this exception.

member.exception: Seeking of the underlying byte stream is required, but the byte stream does not support seeking or the Encodings's Decoder is not serializable.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.Read(System.Int32)

member.exception: length is negative.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.Read(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the length stream chars beginning with the char pointed to by the Iterator into buffer. The chars are written into buffer beginning at the index bufferIndex. If less than length chars are remaining in the stream, only the remaining chars are copied. Returns the actual number of chars copied.
member.exception: bufferIndex is negative, length is negative or bufferIndex + length > buffer.Length.
buffer is null.
Seeking of the underlying byte stream is required, but the byte stream does not support seeking or the Encodings's Decoder is not serializable.

member.summary: Copies the length stream chars beginning with the char pointed to by the Iterator into the buffer at the given pointer address. If less than length chars are remaining in the stream, only the remaining chars are copied. Returns the actual number of chars copied.

length is negative.

The input stream contains invalid bytes and the encoding was constructed with the throwOnInvalidBytes option.

member.name: M:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.ReadUntil(FParsec.CharStream.Iterator)
member.summary: Returns a string with all the chars in the stream between the position of this Iterator (inclusive) and the position of the Iterator in the argument (exclusive). If the Iterator argument does not point to a position after the position of this Iterator, the returned string is empty.
member.exception: iterToCharAfterLastInString belongs to a different CharStream.
There is not enough memory for the string or the requested string is too large.
Seeking of the underlying byte stream is required, but the byte stream does not support seeking or the Encodings's Decoder is not serializable.
An I/O error occured.
The input stream contains invalid bytes and the encoding was constructed with the throwOnInvalidBytes option.
The input stream contains invalid bytes for which the decoder fallback threw this exception.

member.name: P:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.Stream
member.summary: The CharStream over which the Iterator iterates.

member.name: P:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.IsBeginOfStream
member.summary: Indicates whether the Iterator points to the beginning of the CharStream. If the CharStream is empty, this property is always true.

member.name: P:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.IsEndOfStream
member.summary: Indicates whether the Iterator points to the end of the CharStream, i.e. whether it points to one char beyond the last char in the CharStream.

member.name: P:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.Index
member.summary: The index of the stream char pointed to by the Iterator.

member.name: P:FParsec.CharStream.Iterator.Next
member.summary: Returns an Iterator pointing to the next char in the stream. If the Iterator already has reached the end of the stream, i.e. if it points to one char beyond the last char, the same Iterator is returned.
member.exception: Seeking of the underlying byte stream is required, but the byte stream does not support seeking or the Encodings's Decoder is not serializable.
An I/O error occured.
The input stream contains invalid bytes and the encoding was constructed with the throwOnInvalidBytes option.
The input stream contains invalid bytes for which the decoder fallback threw this exception.

member.name: M:FParsec.Helper.DetectPreamble(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Text.Encoding@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Detects the presence of an encoding preamble in the first count bytes of the byte buffer. If detectEncoding is false, this function only searches for the preamble of the given default encoding, otherwise also for any of the standard unicode byte order marks (UTF-8, UTF-16 LE/BE, UTF-32 LE/BE). If an encoding different from the given default encoding is detected, the new encoding is assigned to the encoding reference. Returns the number of bytes in the detected preamble, or 0 if no preamble is detected.

member.name: M:FParsec.Helper.CountTextElements(System.String)
member.summary: A faster implementation of System.Globalization.StringInfo(str).LengthInTextElements.

member.name: T:FParsec.Helper.UTF8EncodingWithNonSerializableDecoder.NonSerializableUTF8Decoder
member.summary: Needed for Test.CharStreamTests and can't be implemented in F#.
